page.title: 13INDUSTRY 2
page.content:
BARRY,CARNOUSTIE IS FORTUNATE IN HAVING ONE OF THE FEW WORKING WATER MILLS IN SCOTLAND.IT STILL HAS THE MILL-LADE,MILLER'S DAM AND AN OVERSHOT WHEEL WHICH IS ENCLOSED.IT IS POWERED BY THE BARRY BURN. TODAY IT IS USED FOR GRINDING OATS,LOCALLY GROWN.HOWEVER FEWER FARMERS ARE GROWING OATS AND THEY ARE BECOMING SCARCER TO BUY EACH YEAR .THE PRESENT OWNERS CONTINUE THE TRADITION OF HUNDREDS OF YEARS BY USING THE OLD SCOTTISH MEASURES-"BOLLS" AND "FIRLOTS" WHEN WEIGHING AND SELLING THE OATS. THE GROUND OATS ARE BOUGHT BY LOCAL HORSE OWNERS AS FODDER FOR PONIES.
{ * a "boll"=32 kilograms { a "firlot"=25 kilograms
